identificationModule.officialTitle: Not a Drug Trial. We Are Using Anti-IgE to Examine the Role of Pulmonary Mast Cells in Asthma

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: We are using anti-IgE to investigate the role of pulmonary mast cells in asthma.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Subjects with mild allergic asthma are examined before, immediately after and 2 months after a course of treatment with anti-IgE. The following are examined: Allergen skin tests, allergen induced asthma, peripheral blood basophils, pulmonary bronchial mucosal mast cells.

armGroups.label: xolair
armGroups.description: This is a single arm, parallel study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes of Xolair. Xolair is being examined as an intervention that might change the outcome of immunization.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Anti-KLH Antibody. This is Measured by ELISA and Expressed as ELISA Units Which Are Derived by Dilution of Serum Samples Until the Result Falls on a Linear Portion of the Response Curve. Final Values Are Derived From ELISA Units and the Serum Dilution
primaryOutcomes.description: Asthma and control patients are immunized with KLH. Mean levels of anti-KLH antibody as described above. This is measured by ELISA and expressed as ELISA units which are derived by dilution of serum samples until the result falls on a linear portion of the response curve. Final values are derived from ELISA units and the serum dilution

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Mild asthma, adults -

Exclusion Criteria:

children. on inhaled or systemic steroids

-

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: No events prior to the study

groups.title: Xolair
groups.description: This is not a drug study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes. This is an open label, non randomized single dose level study in which patients will be treated for 85 days with rhuMAB-E25 (Xolair) and followed for a total of 300 days. The dose of Xolair is determined by the patient's total serum IgE and body weight and is administered subcutaneously every 2 or 4 weeks. Outcome is serum anti-KLH antibody (immunoglobulin classes).

groups.title: Xolair
groups.description: This is not a drug study examining differences of therapeutic outcomes. It uses Xolair as an intervention that might change the outcome of immunization.

outcomeMeasures.title: Anti-KLH Antibody. This is Measured by ELISA and Expressed as ELISA Units Which Are Derived by Dilution of Serum Samples Until the Result Falls on a Linear Portion of the Response Curve. Final Values Are Derived From ELISA Units and the Serum Dilution
outcomeMeasures.description: Asthma and control patients are immunized with KLH. Mean levels of anti-KLH antibody as described above. This is measured by ELISA and expressed as ELISA units which are derived by dilution of serum samples until the result falls on a linear portion of the response curve. Final values are derived from ELISA units and the serum dilution
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Anti-KLH antibody levels of the groups (asthmatics treated with Xolair and placebo) were compared. Both parametric and non parametric statistical techniques were used. There were no differences between the groups.
